column1: Art Institute of Chicago////World Class in all respects
column2: You should plan out your visit and prioritize what to see as you will never cover the whole place in a day and remain coherent. Start at the impressionists on the top floor
column3: probably the best collection in the US of this period
column4: and work your way down. We spent about 1/2 day there exploring
column5: early 20th century American art to Modernism .Good furniture selections too
column6: especially Shaker pieces. We caught America after the Fall: Painting in the 1930s
column7: with the American Gothic and classic Hopper pieces also Abstract/Object which explored Maholy Nagys influence. We took a break for a lunch in the cafeteria the salads were very good
column8: and gave us enough energy to cover all we intended.
